column4: What is the YEAR of publication for the study being assessed? (Note: the earliest appearance, such as 'ahead of print' versions should be primarily considered)
column5: What is the MONTH of publication for the study being assessed? (Note: Consider the earliest appearance such as the 'ahead of print' version)
column6: Copy and Paste the study title
column8: Registration: Is the review registered in a public database?
column9: Registration: If the review is registered, insert the number of registry. (e.g., CRD010101)
column10: Protocol: Is there referral of a publicly available methodological protocol? (Note: if so, you must also use the protocol to consult information about the review)
column11: Title: Is the study identified as a systematic review, meta-analysis, or both?
column12: Abstract: Does the abstract list the data sources used in the review? (Note: if more than five databases were used, simplified or partial referral should be considered as "Yes")
column13: Abstract: Does the abstract inform key eligibility criteria for study selection?
column14: Abstract: Is there a description regarding the population (participants) or main condition(s) addressed in the review?
column15: Abstract: Is there a description regarding the interventions/exposures (or, broadly, independent variables) addressed in the review?
column16: Abstract: Is an effect estimate reported in the abstract?
column17: Abstract: Is there a description of the number of included studies?
column18: Abstract: Is there a result description for the main outcome of interest?
column19: Introduction: Is there a description for the research question (with PICOS elements) or  precisely stated objectives (with PICOS) ?
column20: Methods: How many databases of PUBLISHED evidence were searched?
column21: Methods: Is there at least one search query fully available? (Note: a full search query should allow complete replication)
column22: Methods: Did the search strategy include non-published evidence? ("grey literature")
column23: Methods: If the search is restricted for evidence generated after 1980, is there an indirect or direct justification related to the time range?
column24: Methods: How many languages were considered for study elegibility?
column25: Methods: Is there a detailed explanation of eligibility criteria for PICOS elements? (Note: detailed explanation should allow complete replication)
column26: Methods: Was the study selection carried out in duplicate?
column27: Methods: Was the data extraction carried out in duplicate?
column28: Methods: Is there a description of the assessment of risk of biases?
column29: Methods: Was the assessment of risk of biases carried out in duplicate?
column30: Methods: Is there a description of the statistical combination (meta-analysis) regarding the effect measure (e.g., relative risk or mean difference), statistical method (e.g., inverse variance), and effects approach (fixed or random)?
column31: Methods: Is there a description regarding the assesment of statistical heterogeneity?
column32: Methods: Is there a description of summary measures used to report meta-analytic estimates?
column33: Results: Is there a full description regarding the numbers of references (retrieval, elegibility, synthesis)?
column34: Results: Is there a description about the sample sizes of individual studies?
column35: Results: Is there a full description of characteristics? (Note: the available PICOS elements should be considered)
column36: Results: Is there a description of study duration (follow-up lengths)?
column37: Results: Is there a minimally recommended description of meta-analytic summary estimates?  (Note: binary outcomes as frequencies with and without the event (or as proportions such as 12/45); continuous outcomes as the mean, standard deviation, and sample size for each group)
column38: Results: Is there a full description of individual results for studies composing the meta-analysis? (Note: effects size, imprecision measure and percentage weight should be considered)
column39: Results: Is there a description of risk of bias within studies? (Note: your assessment should be based on the characteristic of the RoB tool)
column40: Results: Is there a description for non-planned modifications to the synthesis during the course of the review? (e.g.: change in eligibility criteria or RoB tools;  please, what was changed and its justification [why] should be considered).
column41: Discussion: Is there a potential spin bias based on a specific reporting strategy to highlight that the experimental treatment (or condition of interest) leads to the hypothesized result?
column42: Discussion: Are the results discussed in light of the risk of biases in individual studies?
column43: Discussion: Are limitations discussed at the study/outcome and/or at the review level?
column44: Is there a statement regarding the data availability (data sharing plan)?
column45: Is there a statement regarding the sources of funding? (Note: funding for the review itself)
column46: If any type of funding was reported, list the agency(ies) and institution(s) that supported the study or researchers. (Note: comma-separated; for review authors only)
column47: Did the review authors declare whether they had any conflicts of interest (COI)?
